page.title: 09Attitudes to life in Wray
page.content: On Thursday June 6th, 1985, I interviewed seven people about their attitudes towards life in Wray and collected the following information. They all enjoy living in the village because the people are friendly and helpful but don't interfere. They like to be part of a community where everyone knows everyone else, and they especially like the countryside. They all agreed that the village should have its own school, but there were differing opinions as to whether there should be more entertainment for children in Wray. Some thought an adventure playground would be a good idea, but others believed that children should find their own entertainment.
